results.title: The Chronicles of Narnia [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Marilyn Fox, Alex Kirby, Paul Stone and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Chronicles of Narnia”.
A breathtaking live action, made for television rendition of C. S. Lewis’ powerful fantasy for all ages using stunning special effects to recreate the most exciting and enchanting adventure of them all. “The Lion, the witch and the wardrobe”: four children, sent from London into the countryside during the dangerous period of WW2, discover the magical world of Narnia - where dwarves, nymphs and giants reside, fauns carry umbrellas, animals talk and horses fly. It is also the land of Aslan, the great lion who can warm the coldest heart and his arch-enemy, the White Witch. “Prince Caspian”: Troubled times have come to Narnia and the evil King Miraz and his scheming Queen Prunaprismia have brought misery and an army of destruction to the peaceful land. Young Prince Caspian, rightful heir to the throne vows to save his kingdom and calls upon the aid of Peter, Susan, Edmund and Lucy. “The Voyage of the dawn treader”: A new quest begins for Edmund and Lucy, who, with their horrible cousin Eustace, join King Caspian on a voyage to find seven missing Lords of Narnia. The Silver chair Old King Caspian’s only son and heir, Prince Rillian has disappeared. The great lion, Aslan, calls on Jill and Eustace, guiding them in their search for the lost prince. On their perilous quest, the children meet up with Puddleglum who travels with them to the land of giants. Their search leads them to face the Green Witch, the Queen of the Deep Realm whose spell they must break. Each edition also available separately on VHS [301499], [301990], [302722].

group.title: The Chronicles of Narnia
group.creator_credit: Alex Kirby, Paul Stone and BBC-TV

results.title: The City: time of decision
results.creator_credit: Tibor Hirsch and United States Information Agency
results.brief_description: Surveys the spiraling problems faced by overcrowded cities in the US and some of the measures taken to solve them. Looks at the evolution of major cities, then examines such present ills as slums, traffic congestion, pollution and over-crowding. Among the solutions pictured are urban renewal projects, rehabilitation, electric transport, traffic regulatory techniques, pollution control devices and the so-called “new towns” such as Reston in Virginia. Narrated by Jim Jensen.

results.title: Penitentiary
results.creator_credit: Ronald Weyman, Sydney Newman and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Canada carries on”.
A report on life and conditions in one of Canada’s penal institutions, illustrating current trends in the treatment of criminals. Defiant and contemptuous of society, a young first offender is brought to a federal penitentiary. The film shows the descipline, the confinement and the rigid routines which are part of a prisoner’s expiation for crime. It also deals with the challenge, now recognized by penitentiary authorities - either to change the prisoner into a law-abiding citizen or to have them come back a repeater - and with the new psychological approach which endeavours to determine the basic causes of a person’s wrong-doing.

results.brief_description: Some of Australia’s earliest films have here been transferred to video for all to see.

group_works.title: The Devil's playground (1928)
group_works.creator_credit: Victor Bindley and Fineart Films Productions

results.title: The Devil's playground (1928)
results.creator_credit: Victor Bindley and Fineart Films Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Reel Australia”.
Somewhere in the South Seas, a beautiful island has become notorious for the “fetish and cannibal rites” of the natives and the “wild doings” of the white population. The native chief, Trelua, leads an insurrection against the whites because of the degradation that his people have suffered since the arrival of the whiteman. A British cruiser comes to the rescue and the native rebellion is quelled, but not before the main white oppressor is killed.

results.title: The City of the dead = Horror hotel
results.creator_credit: John Moxey, Donald Taylor and Vulcan Film (UK)
results.brief_description: A young college student, intrigued by the historical practices of witchcraft conducted in the 17th century, travels to a small town for further investigation. There she meets a mysterious end, leaving her brother and boyfriend to uncover the truth about the town’s malevolent inhabitants. Filmed in black and white, and released the same year as Hitchcock’s “Psycho”, this horror tale is suitably menacing, relying very little on special effects, but more on atmosphere and a chilling narrative. Also known as “Horror hotel”.

A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.

results.title: The Christmas tree
results.creator_credit: M Tsekhanovsky, P. Nosov and Cartoon Film Studios
results.brief_description: An animated Christmas story for young children, in the Disney style, about the forest animals gathering snow-covered Christmas trees in preparation for the Christmas festivities. Father Christmas in the meantime is driving his sleigh through the forest gathering gifts, only to be hindered by two mean foxes. Fortunately the forest animals come to his aid and to celebrate, Father Christmas waves his magical wand to produce a beautiful large Christmas tree covered with gifts. At the stroke of midnight, all the animals and Father Christmas dance around the tree. Russian dialogue - no subtext.

results.title: Crying within
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
A narrative of a schizophrenic girl’s struggle to come to terms with her unstable mind and her wish to have a better life. She speaks of a faceless person, her other self, who goads her into self-mutilation and as a result suffers a recurring nightmare. A disturbing tale of the struggles of coming to terms with dealing with inner voices.
